Sentencas: Apatite-type lanthanum silicate (La10Si6O27; LS) nanopowders are synthesized using a hydrothermal process and used for the electrolyte applications in solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Hydrothermal Synthesis and Characterization of an Apatite-Type Lanthanum Silicate Ceramic for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Electrolyte Applications

Sentencas: The synthesized nanopowders are characterized by Rietveld refinement of the X-ray diffraction (XRD) data, SEM-energy-dispersive X-ray spectroscopy (EDS), TEM, and dialotometry.
Titulo: Hydrothermal Synthesis and Characterization of an Apatite-Type Lanthanum Silicate Ceramic for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Electrolyte Applications

Sentencas: The prepared nanopowders can be sintered to near theoretical density at sintering temperature of 1500 degrees C. Reactivity studies between the synthesized La10Si6O27 material and cathode materials such as La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-delta (LSCF), Nd2NiO4 (NNO), and Pr2NiO4 (PNO), are carried out by XRD analysis revealing that they do not react.
Titulo: Hydrothermal Synthesis and Characterization of an Apatite-Type Lanthanum Silicate Ceramic for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Electrolyte Applications

Sentencas: Symmetric cells are fabricated and characterized electrochemically.
Titulo: Hydrothermal Synthesis and Characterization of an Apatite-Type Lanthanum Silicate Ceramic for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Electrolyte Applications

Sentencas: The area specific resistances for LSCF, NNO, PNO, and PNO-LS (1:1 (wt%)) measured at 900C, are 100, 2.2, 1.8, and 0.5 Omega cm(2), respectively.
Titulo: Hydrothermal Synthesis and Characterization of an Apatite-Type Lanthanum Silicate Ceramic for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Electrolyte Applications

Sentencas: EDS analysis shows that interdiffusion of cations at the cathode-electrolyte interface is not detected for LS/PNO, which is attributed to the low area-specific resistance values.
Titulo: Hydrothermal Synthesis and Characterization of an Apatite-Type Lanthanum Silicate Ceramic for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Electrolyte Applications

Sentencas: The results demonstrate that Pr2NiO4 and the composites are promising cathode materials for the apatite-type lanthanum silicate electrolyte for SOFC applications.
Titulo: Hydrothermal Synthesis and Characterization of an Apatite-Type Lanthanum Silicate Ceramic for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Electrolyte Applications
